originalText.text: Dr. Rodman is brilliant. He has the patients of a Saint. Spends time with you explaining everything needed. I have NEVER seen any other Dr. that comes close to his expertise. He has saved my life numerous times and I cannot thank him enough.

text.text: Dr. Rodman is brilliant. He has the patients of a Saint. Spends time with you explaining everything needed. I have NEVER seen any other Dr. that comes close to his expertise. He has saved my life numerous times and I cannot thank him enough.

originalText.text: Dr. Rodman and his care team are by far the best anywhere.  He is very intelligent and spends a lot of time with each patient. Every visit feels comprehensive.  I can personally say, Dr. Rodman figured out a problem in 10 minutes that doctors in Albany spent 14 years messing with. I'm lucky I am alive and I might not be without Dr. Rodman and all of the specialists he knows.  He only sends you to the best of the best and his staff quickly secures the right treatment the first time.

text.text: Dr. Rodman and his care team are by far the best anywhere.  He is very intelligent and spends a lot of time with each patient. Every visit feels comprehensive.  I can personally say, Dr. Rodman figured out a problem in 10 minutes that doctors in Albany spent 14 years messing with. He only sends you to the best of the best and his staff quickly secures the right treatment the first time.

originalText.text:
Dr. Rodman has been my go-to primary doctor for well over a decade. He is brilliant--intellectally, experientially, and intuitively. He is absolutely an all-around doctor, but has specialty training in hypertension and kidney disease. His crew of "referral" specialist doctors are simply the best NYC has to offer, and that is not hyperbole. Dr. Rodman has seen it all. He deftly deals with high-maintenance, high-information patients like me with tact and good humor.

Never an alarmist, he's a calm, unflappable, methodical person who thinks before you hear his mellow baritone relating his organized, comprehensible (not dumbed-down) ideas, instructions, and options. However, he always considers other conditions that may present with the same issues, particularly if your stats/indicia fall within a classic symptomology. Critically, he remains really engaged by his work.

You do not pay for a fancy office, exam rooms or waiting area; you pay for his time and expertise. His post-exam discussions are totally comprehensive, never rushed. If you call, he calls you back. His staff is friendly. Blood drawn and chest X-rays on site. No credit cards. If you want a doctor with an office that looks like a hip new lounge, go elsewhere. If you want a top-tier physician with a Rolodex that can save your life, look no further. Does he take insurance? Beyond my ken; call and ask; my guess is you must pay and submit for reimbursement (ONLY IF) you have an EPO (not HMO or PPO).  A votre sante!
